question.title: How to programmatically handle container partition redistribution in GridDB cluster after node failure?
question.body:
Question GridDB Container Partition Recovery After Node Failure

I'm working with a 3-node GridDB cluster and need to implement automatic recovery logic when one node fails. My application creates time-series containers with hash partitioning across the cluster.

Code

GridStore store = GridStoreFactory.getInstance().getGridStore(props);
Container<Point, TimeSeries> container = store.getContainer("sensor_data")

Issue: When a node goes down, I need to:

Detect which partitions are affected
Programmatically trigger partition redistribution
Ensure data consistency during recovery

Question: Is there a Java API method to:

  • Query current partition distribution status?
  • Force partition rebalancing after node recovery?
  • Set up callbacks for partition state changes?

The documentation shows cluster management via gs_admin, but I need programmatic control from my Java application.
What I've tried: Using GridStore.getPartitionInfo() but it doesn't provide partition health status or recovery methods.
